Just posting some credibility to this post...even though I'm no specialist in it. I was a statistics TA at BYU for two semesters. It is really easy to spread false propaganda with numbers (DUH). One of the things that has been happening ON THE DAILY are websites showing you the number of positive cases being "confirmed." That would be like news outlets showing us daily how many new births are taking place and how it would peak in June, since that is when most births occur. Watching numbers go up each day, even if it is only a few, is meant to cause FEAR. It is trying to tell you that the numbers are increasing and it is hounding those numbers in your face DAILY. Not giving you a break. If you hear things long enough, you will eventually believe it. You need to compare these numbers and understand the demographics of that population. Look into herd immunity if you are not already familiar with it.
